oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Guy Carawan letter and flyers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Promotional flyers and letter from Myles Horton introducing Guy Carawan, who led the singing program after Zilphia's death. The letter states that Guy is available to come sing and teach in communities around the South.

Guy Carawan was a folk musician and served as Highlander's musical director following Zilphia Horton's death. Carawan is credited with turning We Shall Overcome into a Civil Rights anthem after learning the song from Zilphia Horton at Highlander. Carawan met his future wife Candie Anderson, a Fisk exchange student and an early white participant in sit-ins, at Highlander. Later in life, the Carawans lived near Highlander Research and Education Center in New Market, where he died in 2015.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Horton, Myles, 1905-1990; Carawan, Guy
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); African Americans--Civil rights--Songs and music; Folk musicians; Folklorists; Musicians
